segment.source: Replace a Windows 7 computer with a Windows 10 computer (Windows 10)
segment.target: Replace a Windows 7 computer with a Windows 10 computer (Windows 10)

segment.source: A computer replace scenario for Windows 10 is quite similar to a computer refresh for Windows 10; however, because you are replacing a machine, you cannot store the backup on the old computer.
segment.target: A computer replace scenario for Windows 10 is quite similar to a computer refresh for Windows 10; however, because you are replacing a machine, you cannot store the backup on the old computer.

segment.source: Replace a Windows 7 computer with a Windows 10 computer
segment.target: Replace a Windows 7 computer with a Windows 10 computer

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: A computer replace scenario for Windows 10 is quite similar to a computer refresh for Windows 10; however, because you are replacing a machine, you cannot store the backup on the old computer.
segment.target: A computer replace scenario for Windows 10 is quite similar to a computer refresh for Windows 10; however, because you are replacing a machine, you cannot store the backup on the old computer.

segment.source: Instead you need to store the backup to a location where the new computer can read it.
segment.target: Instead you need to store the backup to a location where the new computer can read it.

segment.source: For the purposes of this topic, we will use four machines: DC01, MDT01, PC0002, and PC0007.
segment.target: For the purposes of this topic, we will use four machines: DC01, MDT01, PC0002, and PC0007.

segment.source: DC01 is a domain controller and MDT01 is a Windows Server 2012 R2 standard server.
segment.target: DC01 is a domain controller and MDT01 is a Windows Server 2012 R2 standard server.

segment.source: PC0002 is an old machine running Windows 7 SP1.
segment.target: PC0002 is an old machine running Windows 7 SP1.

segment.source: It is going to be replaced by a new Windows 10 machine, PC0007.
segment.target: It is going to be replaced by a new Windows 10 machine, PC0007.

segment.source: User State Migration Tool (USMT) will be used to backup and restore data and settings.
segment.target: User State Migration Tool (USMT) will be used to backup and restore data and settings.

segment.source: MDT01, PC0002, and PC0007 are members of the domain contoso.com for the fictitious Contoso Corporation.
segment.target: MDT01, PC0002, and PC0007 are members of the domain contoso.com for the fictitious Contoso Corporation.

segment.source: For more details on the setup for this topic, please see Deploy Windows 10 with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit.
segment.target: For more details on the setup for this topic, please see Deploy Windows 10 with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit.

segment.source: figure 1
segment.target: figure 1

segment.source: Figure 1.
segment.target: Figure 1.

segment.source: The machines used in this topic.
segment.target: The machines used in this topic.

segment.source: Prepare for the computer replace
segment.target: Prepare for the computer replace

segment.source: When preparing for the computer replace, you need to create a folder in which to store the backup, and a backup only task sequence that you run on the old computer.
segment.target: When preparing for the computer replace, you need to create a folder in which to store the backup, and a backup only task sequence that you run on the old computer.

segment.source: Configure the rules on the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) Production share
segment.target: Configure the rules on the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) Production share

segment.source: On MDT01, using the Deployment Workbench, update the MDT Production deployment share rules.
segment.target: On MDT01, using the Deployment Workbench, update the MDT Production deployment share rules.

segment.source: Change the SkipUserData=YES option to NO, and click OK.
segment.target: Change the SkipUserData=YES option to NO, and click OK.

segment.source: Create and share the MigData folder
segment.target: Create and share the MigData folder

segment.source: On MDT01, log on as CONTOSOAdministrator.
segment.target: On MDT01, log on as CONTOSOAdministrator.

segment.source: Create and share the E:MigData folder by running the following three commands in an elevated Windows PowerShell prompt:
segment.target: Create and share the E:MigData folder by running the following three commands in an elevated Windows PowerShell prompt:

segment.source: Create a backup only (replace) task sequence
segment.target: Create a backup only (replace) task sequence

segment.source: On MDT01, using the Deployment Workbench, in the MDT Production deployment share, select the Task Sequences node and create a new folder named Other.
segment.target: On MDT01, using the Deployment Workbench, in the MDT Production deployment share, select the Task Sequences node and create a new folder named Other.

segment.source: Right-click the Other folder and select New Task Sequence.
segment.target: Right-click the Other folder and select New Task Sequence.

segment.source: Use the following settings for the New Task Sequence Wizard:
segment.target: Use the following settings for the New Task Sequence Wizard:

segment.source: Task sequence ID: REPLACE-001
segment.target: Task sequence ID: REPLACE-001

segment.source: Task sequence name: Backup Only Task Sequence
segment.target: Task sequence name: Backup Only Task Sequence

segment.source: Task sequence comments: Run USMT to backup user data and settings
segment.target: Task sequence comments: Run USMT to backup user data and settings

segment.source: Template: Standard Client Replace Task Sequence
segment.target: Template: Standard Client Replace Task Sequence

segment.source: In the Other folder, double-click Backup Only Task Sequence, and then in the Task Sequence tab, review the sequence.
segment.target: In the Other folder, double-click Backup Only Task Sequence, and then in the Task Sequence tab, review the sequence.

segment.source: Notice that it only contains a subset of the normal client task sequence actions.
segment.target: Notice that it only contains a subset of the normal client task sequence actions.

segment.source: figure 2
segment.target: figure 2

segment.source: Figure 2.
segment.target: Figure 2.

segment.source: The Backup Only Task Sequence action list.
segment.target: The Backup Only Task Sequence action list.

segment.source: Perform the computer replace
segment.target: Perform the computer replace

segment.source: During a computer replace, these are the high-level steps that occur:
segment.target: During a computer replace, these are the high-level steps that occur:

segment.source: On the computer you are replacing, a special replace task sequence runs the USMT backup and, if you configured it, runs the optional full Window Imaging (WIM) backup.
segment.target: On the computer you are replacing, a special replace task sequence runs the USMT backup and, if you configured it, runs the optional full Window Imaging (WIM) backup.

segment.source: On the new machine, you perform a standard bare-metal deployment.
segment.target: On the new machine, you perform a standard bare-metal deployment.

segment.source: At the end of the bare-metal deployment, the USMT backup from the old computer is restored.
segment.target: At the end of the bare-metal deployment, the USMT backup from the old computer is restored.

segment.source: Execute the replace task sequence
segment.target: Execute the replace task sequence

segment.source: On PC0002, log on as CONTOSOAdministrator.
segment.target: On PC0002, log on as CONTOSOAdministrator.

segment.source: Verify that you have write access to the MDT01MigData$ share.
segment.target: Verify that you have write access to the MDT01MigData$ share.

segment.source: Execute MDT01MDTProduction$ScriptsLiteTouch.vbs.
segment.target: Execute MDT01MDTProduction$ScriptsLiteTouch.vbs.

segment.source: Complete the Windows Deployment Wizard using the following settings:
segment.target: Complete the Windows Deployment Wizard using the following settings:

segment.source: Select a task sequence to execute on this computer: Backup Only Task Sequence
segment.target: Select a task sequence to execute on this computer: Backup Only Task Sequence

segment.source: Specify where to save your data and settings: Specify a location
segment.target: Specify where to save your data and settings: Specify a location

segment.source: Location: MDT01MigData$PC0002 Note
segment.target: Location: MDT01MigData$PC0002 Note

segment.source: If you are replacing the computer at a remote site you should create the MigData folder on MDT02 and use that share instead.
segment.target: If you are replacing the computer at a remote site you should create the MigData folder on MDT02 and use that share instead.

segment.source: Specify where to save a complete computer backup: Do not back up the existing computer
segment.target: Specify where to save a complete computer backup: Do not back up the existing computer

segment.source: Password: P@ssw0rd
segment.target: Password: P@ssw0rd

segment.source: The task sequence will now run USMT (Scanstate.exe) to capture user data and settings of the machine.
segment.target: The task sequence will now run USMT (Scanstate.exe) to capture user data and settings of the machine.

segment.source: figure 3
segment.target: figure 3

segment.source: Figure 3.
segment.target: Figure 3.

segment.source: The new task sequence running the Capture User State action on PC0002.
segment.target: The new task sequence running the Capture User State action on PC0002.

segment.source: On MDT01, verify that you have an USMT.MIG compressed backup file in the E:MigDataPC0002USMT folder.
segment.target: On MDT01, verify that you have an USMT.MIG compressed backup file in the E:MigDataPC0002USMT folder.

segment.source: figure 4
segment.target: figure 4

segment.source: Figure 4.
segment.target: Figure 4.

segment.source: The USMT backup of PC0002.
segment.target: The USMT backup of PC0002.

segment.source: Deploy the PC0007 virtual machine
segment.target: Deploy the PC0007 virtual machine

segment.source: Create a virtual machine with the following settings:
segment.target: Create a virtual machine with the following settings:

segment.source: Name: PC0007
segment.target: Name: PC0007

segment.source: Location: C:VMs
segment.target: Location: C:VMs

segment.source: Generation: 2
segment.target: Generation: 2

segment.source: Memory: 2048 MB
segment.target: Memory: 2048 MB

segment.source: Hard disk: 60 GB (dynamic disk)
segment.target: Hard disk: 60 GB (dynamic disk)

segment.source: Start the PC0007 virtual machine, and press Enter to start the Pre-Boot Execution Environment (PXE) boot.
segment.target: Start the PC0007 virtual machine, and press Enter to start the Pre-Boot Execution Environment (PXE) boot.

segment.source: The machine will now load the Windows PE boot image from the WDS server.
segment.target: The machine will now load the Windows PE boot image from the WDS server.

segment.source: figure 5
segment.target: figure 5

segment.source: Figure 5.
segment.target: Figure 5.

segment.source: The initial PXE boot process of PC0005.
segment.target: The initial PXE boot process of PC0005.

segment.source: After Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE) has booted, complete the Windows Deployment Wizard using the following settings:
segment.target: After Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE) has booted, complete the Windows Deployment Wizard using the following settings:

segment.source: Password: P@ssw0rd
segment.target: Password: P@ssw0rd

segment.source: Select a task sequence to execute on this computer:
segment.target: Select a task sequence to execute on this computer:

segment.source: Windows 10 Enterprise x64 RTM Custom Image
segment.target: Windows 10 Enterprise x64 RTM Custom Image

segment.source: Computer Name: PC0007
segment.target: Computer Name: PC0007

segment.source: Applications: Select the Install - Adobe Reader XI - x86 application.
segment.target: Applications: Select the Install - Adobe Reader XI - x86 application.

segment.source: The setup now starts and does the following:
segment.target: The setup now starts and does the following:

segment.source: Installs the Windows 10 Enterprise operating system.
segment.target: Installs the Windows 10 Enterprise operating system.

segment.source: Installs the added application.
segment.target: Installs the added application.

segment.source: Updates the operating system via your local Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) server.
segment.target: Updates the operating system via your local Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) server.

segment.source: Restores the USMT backup from PC0002.
segment.target: Restores the USMT backup from PC0002.
